hst.description: Search Position (RA and Dec)
hst.name: search_pos

hst.description: Data set name, the first character indicates instrument; L=COS; I=WFC3; J=ACS; N=NICMOS; O=STIS; U=WFPC2; W=WFPC; X=FOC; Y=FOS; Z=GHRS; F=FGS; V=HSP; nine-character name    (e.g. J8BA7JCAQ, O4140Q020)
hst.name: sci_data_set_name

hst.description: Target name designated by the observer for the HST proposal; Uppercase; No blank characters; Spaces sometimes filled with - ;    (e.g. A901-FIELD-25, NGC4486-POS1, 0537-441INCA221-36, ALPHA-CEN)
hst.name: sci_targname

hst.description: Reports if there are any Hubble Advanced Products (HAP), enter 0 for no, 1 for yes
hst.name: sci_hapnum

hst.description: Reports if there are any Hubble Advanced Spectral Products (HASP), enter 0 for no, 1 for yes
hst.name: sci_haspnum

hst.description: Instrument used    (e.g. ACS, COS, FGS, FOC, FOS, HRS, HSP, NICMOS, STIS, WFC3, WFPC, WFPC2)
hst.name: sci_instrume

hst.description: Aperture configuration;    WFPC2 (e.g. PC1, WF3, WFALL); ACS (e.g. WFC, HRC, SBC); STIS (e.g. 25MAMA, F25QTZ)
hst.name: sci_aper_1234

hst.description: The filter(s) or grating(s) used    (e.g. G160L, G270M, G230LB, F300W)
hst.name: sci_spec_1234

hst.description: Exposure time in seconds
hst.name: sci_actual_duration

hst.description: Observation start time; The earliest in-flight data is available from Apr 24 1990
hst.name: sci_start_time

hst.description: ID number (integer) assigned to the proposal    (e.g. 1012, 12045)
hst.name: sci_pep_id

hst.description: Principal Investigator (PI) last name; uppercase    (e.g. FORD, LEMMON)
hst.name: sci_pi_last_name

hst.description: Right Ascension (J2000), from 0 to 360, in degrees
hst.name: sci_ra

hst.description: Declination (J2000), from -90 to +90, in degrees
hst.name: sci_dec

hst.description: Archive ingest classification, where the only choices are CAL='calibrated science' and AST='astrometric' (FGS only)
hst.name: sci_archive_class

hst.description: Internal program ID, which is not the same as proposal ID;    Three-character name    (e.g. 8G6, 9FA, 8M8, 4QA)
hst.name: sci_program_id

hst.description: Observation set ID, indicating the fourth and fifth letters of a dataset name. In most cases, this is usually the observation visit number;    Two-character name    (e.g. 10, 42, G1, GA, H6)
hst.name: sci_obset_id

hst.description: Observation number, used in the Science Operations Ground System (SOGS) header;    (e.g. 01, 02, RO, 011, AK, 070)
hst.name: sci_obsnum

hst.description: The association ID for the dataset (result of combining individual exposures), identical to the data set name;  If used to build an association, this field indicates the combined data sets (e.g. null, O4QA01010, J8ZO02010)
hst.name: sci_asn_id

hst.description: Target description specified by the observer from a key field used in the Astronomer's Proposal Tool (APT); Uppercase (e.g. GALAXY;SEYFERT;STARBURST, ISM;HI CLOUD, STAR;PULSAR, PLANET;EXOSPHERE OF MARS)
hst.name: sci_target_descrip

hst.description: One or more target classifications assigned by the observer from HST broad target categories; Uppercase (e.g. CLUSTER OF GALAXIES;GALAXY, EXT-CLUSTER;ISM, STAR;EXT-CLUSTER, SOLAR SYSTEM, CALIBRATION)
hst.name: sci_broad_category

hst.description: The number of known literature references associated with the proposal ID or data set name
hst.name: sci_refnum

hst.description: Right Ascension (J2000) at V1 position, from 0 to 360, in degrees, where the +V1 is pointing from the primary mirror along the optical axis toward the secondary mirror
hst.name: sci_ra_v1

hst.description: Declination (J2000) at V1 position, from -90 to +90, in degrees, where the +V1 is pointing from the primary mirror along the optical axis toward the secondary mirror
hst.name: sci_dec_v1

hst.description: Exposure interruption indicator    (e.g. NORMAL, INCOMPLETE, UNCERTAIN, INTERRUPTED, EXTENDED, PREDICTED, INDETERMINATE, UNKNOWN, EXCESSIVE DOW, DETOFF)
hst.name: sci_expflag

hst.description: Instrument configuration    (e.g. ACS/HRC, COS/FUV, STIS/CCD, STIS/FUV-MAMA, WFC3/IR, WFC3/UVIS, WFPC2)
hst.name: sci_instrument_config

hst.description: Operating (data taking) mode    (e.g. ACQ, RAMP, SCAN, SPEC, ACCUM, IMAGE, RAPID, UNKNOWN)
hst.name: sci_operating_mode

hst.description: Spectral resolving power (R=λ/Δλ); Typical range is up to 114000 and depends on the instrument used
hst.name: sci_spectral_res

hst.description: Maximum wavelength for spectrum, in Angstroms
hst.name: sci_spectrum_end

hst.description: Minimum wavelength for spectrum, in Angstroms
hst.name: sci_spectrum_start

hst.description: Bandwidth of the data or root mean squares (RMS) bandwidth of the photmode (NICMOS) or filter plus detector (ACS)    (e.g. WFC3 (2000-17000 A), COS/FUV (1150 - 2050 A))
hst.name: sci_bandwidth

hst.description: Central wavelength, in Angstroms, of the bandpass for filters or gratings used; It depends on the instrument
hst.name: sci_central_wavelength

hst.description: Dispersion of grating; Typical range is up to 70.28 Angstroms/pixel and depends on the instrument used
hst.name: sci_dispersion

hst.description: Pixel resolution (arcsec/pixel)
hst.name: sci_pixel_res

hst.description: Fine Guidance Sensors (FGS) lock status    (e.g. FINE, GYROS, COARSE, FINE/GYRO, UNKNOWN)
hst.name: sci_fgslock

hst.description: Moving Target Flag (T=True means a Moving Target, or F=False)
hst.name: sci_mtflag

hst.description: Date of public release; The earliest date is available from May 9, 1990
hst.name: sci_release_date

hst.description: Observation stop time; The earliest in-flight data is available from Apr 24 1990
hst.name: sci_stop_time

hst.description: The V3 position angle, from 0 to 360, in degrees; It is measured from North to East toward the projection of the V3 axis on the sky; V3 is an axis of the HST coordinate system aligning with the High Gain Antenna
hst.name: sci_v3_pos_angle

hst.description: Ecliptic Latitude (J2000), from -90 to +90, in degrees
hst.name: sci_ecliptic_latitude

hst.description: Ecliptic Longitude (J2000), from 0 to 360, in degrees
hst.name: sci_ecliptic_longitude

hst.description: Galactic Latitude (J2000), from -90 to +90, in degrees
hst.name: sci_galactic_latitude

hst.description: Galactic Longitude (J2000), from 0 to 360, in degrees
hst.name: sci_galactic_longitude

hst.description: Altitude of the Sun above the Earth's limb from -66 to 114, in degrees
hst.name: sci_sun_alt

hst.description: Position angle of aperture, from -180 to +360, in degrees, which is the angle measured from North to East toward the aperture's y-axis
hst.name: sci_pa_aper

hst.description: This indicates if the Corrective Optics Space Telescope Axial Replacement (COSTAR) was deployed; (T=True means deployed, or F=False)
hst.name: sci_costar_deploy

hst.description: Archived Exposures Catalog (AEC); Purpose of observation (C=Calibration, S=Science)
hst.name: sci_aec

hst.description: Field of view (FOV) configuration (LAUNCH, SM-1, SM-2, SM-3, SM-4)
hst.name: sci_fov_config

hst.description: The date when associated data products were generated by the processing pipeline; The earliest data is available from Feb 12 1992
hst.name: sci_generation_date

hst.description: The date when archiving was completed; The earliest data is available from Dec 23, 1993
hst.name: sci_archive_date

hst.description: Preview name, generally the same as the data set name    (e.g. J9FAHGH5Q)
hst.name: sci_preview_name

hst.description: Observation category; ASTROMETERY (FGS only), IMAGE, PHOTOMETRY (HSP only), SPECTRUM
hst.name: sci_obs_type

hst.description: Observation scan mode; one of two types of spatial scan (C=observation taken in continuous scan mode, or D=observation taken in scan mode with a dwell)
hst.name: scp_scan_type

hst.description: Number of known High Level Science Products
hst.name: sci_hlsp

hst.description: Angular Separation
hst.name: ang_sep

hst.description: Data access status (PUBLIC or PROPRIETARY=exclusive data)
hst.name: sci_status

hst.description: Search Key (Concat of sci_data_set_name and search_pos)
hst.name: search_key

jwst.description: Search Position (RA and Dec)
jwst.name: search_pos

jwst.description: ArchiveFileID
jwst.name: ArchiveFileID

jwst.description: Of the form jwpppppooovvv_ggsaa_eeeee where ppppp - Program Number, ooo - Observation Number, vvv - Visit Number, gg - Visit Group, s - Parallel Sequence id (1 prime, 2-5 parallel), aa - Activity (base 36), and eeeee - Exposure Number, all padded by zeros where necessary. Source-based data set names are expressed as jwppppp-oOOO_tTTT_instrument, where: ppppp - Program number, OOO - observation number, TTT - target number, and instrument - Instrument name
jwst.name: fileSetName

jwst.description: Product levels, 1b is an Uncal FITS file, 2a = Countrate exposure, 2b = calibrated exposure, 2c = cosmic-ray-flagged exposure, and 3 = combined data.
jwst.name: productLevel

jwst.description: Proposer prefered name for the target
jwst.name: targprop

jwst.description: Standard astronomical catalog name for the target
jwst.name: targname

jwst.description: Right Ascension (J2000), from 0 to 360, in degrees
jwst.name: targ_ra

jwst.description: Declination (J2000), from -90 to +90, in degrees
jwst.name: targ_dec

jwst.description: Identifies the instrument used to acquire the data.
jwst.name: instrume

jwst.description: Exposure type is used by DMS to direct Science Data Processing code (SDP) and calibration, as well as provide metadata for archive searches. For a given template the EXP_TYPE keyword value is obtained for each exposure from the EXPOSURE_TYPE exposure-level parameter in the Observatory Status File (OSF). In a few cases, additional information is required to set the value for the EXP_TYPE keyword
jwst.name: exp_type

jwst.description: A comma-separated list of filters, gratings, pupil, channel, band, & coronmsk used (e.g. F150W, G140H, CH12;SHORT, F290LP)
jwst.name: opticalElements

jwst.description: Identifies the element of the filter wheel that was in the optical path for the exposure, for one of NIRCAM, NIRISS, NIRSPEC, or MIRI
jwst.name: filter

jwst.description: UTC date of the start of the exposure with format yyyy-mm-dd hh:mm:ss.ss. The start date is calculated by Science Data Processing code (SDP) based on the science telemetry image headers time stamps and the calculated exposure duration
jwst.name: date_obs

jwst.description: Total duration of exposure in sec, exclusive of dead time.
jwst.name: duration

jwst.description: The 5-digit number that identifies the observing program used to obtain the data.
jwst.name: program

jwst.description: The observation number is three character number that specifies an observation within a parallel proposal (note: large numbers of observations are expected per proposal).
jwst.name: observtn

jwst.description: The visit number is a three character number that indentifies the visit within an observation. Multiple visits per observation are needed for mosaics and some long observations. Note fields that trace back to the proposal are called numbers rather than IDs to emphasize that only decimal numbers can be used.
jwst.name: visit

jwst.description: Date of public release
jwst.name: publicReleaseDate

jwst.description: Name of principal investigator (last, first, mi).
jwst.name: pi_name

jwst.description: The program type. Includes Early Release Observations (ERO), Early Release Science (ERS), General Observers (GO), Guaranteed Time Observations (GTO), Director's Discretionary (DD), Survey Proposals (SURVEY), NASA Proposals (NASA), Calibration Proposals (Calibration), and Treasury Proposals (Treasury)
jwst.name: proposal_type

jwst.description: The proposal cycle in which the observation is associated with
jwst.name: proposal_cycle

jwst.description: Fixed target, moving target, or generic target (e.g., FIXED, MOVING, GENERIC, UNKNOWN)
jwst.name: targtype

jwst.description: Proposer (user-defined) label for the observation
jwst.name: obslabel

jwst.description: Observation template used in the proposal instruction to specify the observation
jwst.name: template

jwst.description: Spatial Footprint
jwst.name: s_region

jwst.description: Data access status (PUBLIC or EXCLUSIVE_ACCESS)
jwst.name: access

jwst.description: The activity identifier is a two character indentifier (base 36), which identifies activity within a sequence. It is included in the observation ID
jwst.name: act_id

jwst.description: The S&OC Project Reference Database (S&OC PRD) aperture used. The names for each JWST aperture are used to populate the APERNAME keyword based on engineering telemetry. For NIRCam Time Series and Grism Time Series templates a subset of the NIRCam detectors will be read out. The PPS database specifies a single aperture for each exposure that is used for telescope pointing. For NIRCam multi-detector exposures, the PPS provided aperture name is mapped to detector specific apertures for identifying the best reference pixel from which to set the WCS parameters for the individual exposure/detector based FITS files. Special mapping will need to be performed for the NIRCam Time Series and Grism Time Series templates. See JWST Keyword Dictionary
jwst.name: apername

jwst.description: Barycentric time correction from UTC in units of seconds, calculated at exposure start time. See JWST Keyword Dictionary
jwst.name: bartdelt

jwst.description: Exposure end time using the UTC timescale, expressed as MJD, but with the barycentric time correction (from BARTDELT) applied. See JWST Keyword Dictionary
jwst.name: bendtime

jwst.description: Exposure mid time using the UTC timescale, expressed as MJD, but with the barycentric time correction (from BARTDELT) applied. See JWST Keyword Dictionary
jwst.name: bmidtime

jwst.description: Exposure start time using the UTC timescale, expressed as MJD, but with the barycentric time correction (from BARTDELT) applied. See JWST Keyword Dictionary
jwst.name: bstrtime

jwst.description: Indicates whether the proposer flagged the target or target field contained in the exposure to be used as a background target for other exposures
jwst.name: bkgdtarg

jwst.description: The category keyword value describes the type of proposal submitted: archive (AR), calibration (CAL), director discretionary (DD), engineering (ENG), General Observer (GO), Guaranteed Time Observer (GTO), or NASA
jwst.name: category

jwst.description: Spacecraft clock time adjustment rate as derived from offset values between the UTC spacecraft time and ground time. A value of zero indicates that a spacecraft clock time adjustment was not in progress during the exposure
jwst.name: sctarate

jwst.description: Continuation of the specified previous program
jwst.name: cont_id

jwst.description: The EXPCOUNT keyword will be used to count the number of exposures in a visit. The value for the EXPOSURE keyword is intially extracted from the image header in the science telemetry and is reset for each new activity within a visit. Science Data Processing code (SDP) determines a monotonically increasing exposure count within a visit, and capture that number in the EXPCOUNT keyword value. This exposure count will reflect the order in which the exposures were executed
jwst.name: expcount

jwst.description: T if science telemetry indicated any problems with the data
jwst.name: dataprob

jwst.description: Post-processing method used in FPAP (Focal Plane Array Processor); maps to readout pattern. Possible values are 0-86
jwst.name: datamode

jwst.description: The UTC date and time when the HDU was created, in the form YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss, where YYYY shall be the four-digit calendar year number, MM the two-digit month number with January given by 01 and December by 12, and DD the two-digit day of the month. The literal T shall separate the date and time, hh shall be the two-digit hour in the day, mm the two-digit number of minutes after the hour, and ss the number of seconds after the minute. Default values must not be given to any portion of the date/time string, and leading zeros must not be omitted
jwst.name: date

jwst.description: DateTime start of data acquisition, formatted as an ISO-8601 string, yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss
jwst.name: date_beg

jwst.description: DateTime end of data acquisition, formatted as an ISO-8601 string, yyyy-mm-ddThh:mm:ss.sss. The end date is calculated by Science Data Processing code (SDP) based on the science telemetry image headers time stamps
jwst.name: date_end

jwst.description: Target Declination Uncertainty computed at mid time of the exposure (arcseconds)
jwst.name: targudec

jwst.description: A concatenation of target description keywords specified in the APT proposal, separated by semicolons
jwst.name: targdesc

jwst.description: Name of the Sensor Chip Assembly (SCA) detector used to acquire the data. The APID-to-detector map is configured in the S&OC Project Reference Database (PRD). During science SSR file processing, the APID is obtained from the SSR data and is used to get the DETECTOR from the PRD table. It identifies the physical SCA detector from which the pixel values in the data array were read
jwst.name: detector

jwst.description: The name of the direct image used during processing of Wide Field Slitless Spectroscopy (WFSS) grism exposures
jwst.name: dirimage

jwst.description: Number of frames dropped prior to first integration
jwst.name: drpfrms1

jwst.description: Number of frames dropped between integrations
jwst.name: drpfrms3

jwst.description: Effective duration of an exposure, corrected for dead time (i.e., it is the photon counting time); equivalent to keyword EFFEXPTM (seconds)
jwst.name: effexptm

jwst.description: Total duration of the exposure, including dead times; computed as the difference between exposure end and start times; equivalent to keyword DURATION (seconds)
jwst.name: texptime

jwst.description: Time of the last data readout within this exposure (Modified Julian Date).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword MJD-END for this quantity
jwst.name: expend

jwst.description: This keyword indicates the source/quality of the spacecraft pointing keywords. The input mnemonics required to calculate the pointing are queried from the Engineering telemetry database for the time range of the exposure. If the mnemonics are NOT found, the planned pointing, from keywords TARG_RA/TARG_DEC, are used and ENGQLPTG is set to PLANNED. If the input mnemonics are retrieved, the spacecraft pointing values are calculated from them and ENGQLPTG is set to one of the following: CALCULATED (an alias for CALCULATED_ORIGINAL); CALCULATED_ORIGINAL (pointing calculated by the original, pre-finalized algorithm based on spacecraft orientation); CALCULATED_COARSE_TR_202107 (pointing calculated for COARSE mode tracking from the 2021-07 version of the Technical Report (TR)); CALCULATED_COARSE_TR_202111 (pointing calculated for COARSE mode tracking from the 2021-11 version of the TR); CALCULATED_GSCMD (pointing calculated based on commanded guide star position); CALCULATED_GSCMD_V3PAGS (pointing calculated using estimated V3 position angle), CALCULATED_TR_202105 (pointing calculated from spacecraft orientation without velocity aberration correction from the 2021-05 version of the TR); CALCULATED_TR_202105_VA (pointing calculated from spacecraft orientation with velocity aberration correction from the 2021-05 version of the TR); CALCULATED_TRACK_TR_202107 (pointing calculated for TRACK/FINEGUIDE mode tracking from the 2021-07 version of the TR); or CALCULATED_TRACK_TR_202111 (pointing calculated for TRACK/FINEGUIDE/MOVING mode tracking from the 2021-11 version of the TR)
jwst.name: engqlptg

jwst.description: If not = OK (value=SUSPECT), indicates that one or more level1b FITS keywords filled via the engineering database calls are suspected of having incorrect values because the engineering values were only found outside the exposure start,end range
jwst.name: eng_qual

jwst.description: The type of values contained in the error array. ERR = standard deviation; IERR = inverse standard deviation; VAR = variance; IVAR = inverse variance
jwst.name: errtype

jwst.description: EXP_ONLY flags if exposure was taken through special commanding without SI configuration
jwst.name: exp_only

jwst.description: The exposure request number within a single activity is 5 characters long and is included in the observation ID
jwst.name: exposure

jwst.description: Effective exposure time, corrected for dead time and lost time (seconds).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword XPOSURE for this quantity
jwst.name: effexptm

jwst.description: Indicates the axis and direction of fast readout (values = 1, 2, -1, -2). The digit value is set by whether axis 1 or 2 is the fast/slow readout axis. The sign indicates the direction of the readout with respect to the science frame
jwst.name: fastaxis

jwst.description: Time between start of successive frames in units of seconds
jwst.name: tframe

jwst.description: Records the value of the frame divisor used on-board when the flight software averages multiple frames (detector readouts) into a single group
jwst.name: frmdivsr

jwst.description: The data scaling factor, expressed as a ratio, between exposures obtained with gain=2 and the nominal gain=1 setting
jwst.name: gainfact

jwst.description: Time between start of successive groups in units of seconds
jwst.name: tgroup

jwst.description: Number of frames skipped between groups
jwst.name: groupgap

jwst.description: ICRS declination of guide star
jwst.name: gs_dec

jwst.description: The guide star identifier is a 10 character, base 36 number identifying celestial objects included in Guide Star Catalog two
jwst.name: gdstarid

jwst.description: Guide star magnitude in FGS detector. Defined range: -99..99
jwst.name: gs_mag

jwst.description: The index of this guide star within the list of selected guide stars
jwst.name: gs_order

jwst.description: Pointing Control System (PCS) mode: Fine Guide, Coarse, None, Track, Moving. For COARSE Visit is executed under fixed head star tracker control. For FINEGUIDE the fixed target visit is executed using guide stars in fine guiding mode. For TRACK the fixed target visit is to be executed using guide stars but not using fine guiding mode. This mode is intended to be used when the telescope focus is not optimal, during commissioning or special engineering tests. For MOVING the moving target visit is to be executed by tracking using guide stars. NONE indicates that the visit does not need to be pointed. It will be used for special visits, such as for loading on-board scripts or other non-standard internal activities
jwst.name: pcs_mode

jwst.description: ICRS right ascension of guide star
jwst.name: gs_dra

jwst.description: Observatory UTC time when guide star activity started
jwst.name: gsstrttm

jwst.description: UTC end time of guide star acquisition activity completed
jwst.name: gsendtim

jwst.description: ICRS declination uncertainty of guide star
jwst.name: gs_udec

jwst.description: Guide star magnitude uncertainty. Defined range: -99..99
jwst.name: gs_umag

jwst.description: ICRS right ascension uncertainty of guide star
jwst.name: gs_ura

jwst.description: V3 position angle of the guide star, measured at the guide star location, to be used for the science attitude. Range is -360 to +360
jwst.name: gs_v3_pa

jwst.description: Guiding start time in MJD format
jwst.name: gsstrttm

jwst.description: Guiding end time in MJD format
jwst.name: gsendtim

jwst.description: Heliocentric time correction from UTC in units of seconds, calculated at exposure start time
jwst.name: helidelt

jwst.description: Heliocentric exposure start time (Modified Julian Date)
jwst.name: hstrtime

jwst.description: Heliocentric exposure mid time (Modified Julian Date)
jwst.name: hmidtime

jwst.description: Heliocentric exposure end time (Modified Julian Date)
jwst.name: hendtime

jwst.description: High Gain Antenna (HGA) moved during data collection (T/F)
jwst.name: hga_move

jwst.description: For segmented exposure products, this keyword gives the number of the first integration contained within the segment
jwst.name: intstart

jwst.description: For segmented exposure products, this keyword gives the number of the last integration contained within the segment
jwst.name: intend

jwst.description: Effective integration time in units of seconds
jwst.name: effinttm

jwst.description: T if at least one exposure in the visit is internally targeted. F if no exposure in the visit is internally targeted
jwst.name: intarget

jwst.description: Records the overall background signal level computed by the skymatch step during calibration pipeline processing
jwst.name: bkglevel

jwst.description: Exposure mid time (Modified Julian Date).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword MJD-AVG for this quantity
jwst.name: expmid

jwst.description: The DATAMODL keyword records the name of the calibration pipeline software data model class to be used when loading/accessing the data in the FITS file
jwst.name: datamodl

jwst.description: Number of file extensions
jwst.name: nextend

jwst.description: Number of frames per group
jwst.name: nframes

jwst.description: Number of groups in integration. Each integration within an exposure is required to have the same number of groups. The total number of groups in an exposure is determined by NGROUPS * NINTS. One exception to this is for instrument MIRI with readout pattern FASTGRPAVG, where the instrument flight settings are inconsistent with other modes. In this case NGROUPS per integration is calculated as NGROUPS = NGROUPS / NFRAMES, where NFRAMES=FRMDIVSR
jwst.name: ngroups

jwst.description: Number of integrations within the exposure. An exposure consists of one or more integrations, and an integration contains one or more groups. Each integration within an exposure is required to have the same number of groups. For NINTS of one , the count rate image produced in the level 2a data product is single two-dimensional data array contained in FITS science image extension. For NINTS greater than one, a second level 2a product will be generated with a separate count rate image for each integration within the exposure
jwst.name: nints

jwst.description: The LAMP keyword identifies the MIRI, FGS, NIRISS, or NIRSPEC internal lamp state
jwst.name: lamp

jwst.description: The name of the file containing the 1-D master background spectrum used in the master background subtraction step. Can be supplied by the user or created by the pipeline step
jwst.name: masterbg

jwst.description: The name of the sky computation method used in the level-3 calibration step 'skymatch'
jwst.name: bkgmeth

jwst.description: The keyword NOUTPUTS indicates the number of detector amplifier outputs that were used for reading the detector.  The value can be 1, 4, or 5 for various modes of the NIRCam, NIRISS, and NIRSpec instruments
jwst.name: noutputs

jwst.description: Number of resets at start of exposure
jwst.name: nrststrt

jwst.description: Number of resets that separate integrations within an exposure
jwst.name: nresets

jwst.description: Number of A/D samples per read of pixel. One in every mode but MIRI SLOW which has a value of ten
jwst.name: nsamples

jwst.description: Exposure start time from the next WFS exposure (Modified Julian Date)
jwst.name: nwfsest

jwst.description: OBS_ID and related keywords example - OBS_ID = 'V80600013001P0000000002101' / Programmatic observation identifier; VISIT_ID= '80600013001' / Visit identifier; PROGRAM = '80600 ' / Program number; OBSERVTN= '013 ' / Observation number; VISIT = '001 ' / Visit number; VISITGRP= '02 ' / Visit group identifier; SEQ_ID = '1 ' / Parallel sequence identifier; ACT_ID = '01 ' / Activity identifier; EXPOSURE= '1 ' / Exposure request number; visit_id = Program number + Observation number + Visit number. The OBS_ID = 'V' + visit_id + 'P' + parallel-program number + parallel-observation number + visit group identifier + parallel sequence identifier + activity_identifier. The eight characters after the 'P' are only populated with non-zero values of the parallel program number and observation number if the exposure is a parallel. Parallel observations occur in the same visit as the prime observation, so the visit number is not needed after the 'P'. For a prime exposure with one or more exposures executing in parallel, only the prime program number and observation number will be populated. For a parallel exposure, both the prime program number / observation number and the parallel program number / observation number will be populated. The exposure_id is not included in the OBS_ID. It is a separate field in the science image header of the ssr file. Some of the nomenclature is confusing, especially the over use of observation in programmatic observation identifier and observation number
jwst.name: obs_id

jwst.description: The name of the APT observation folder in which this observation is contained
jwst.name: obsfolder

jwst.description: Identifies the organization or institution responsible for creating the FITS file
jwst.name: origin

jwst.description: Observatory Status File (OSF) name containing the CompletedExposure row for this exposure
jwst.name: osf_file

jwst.description: Version number of the Observatory Scheduling Software (OSS)
jwst.name: oss_ver

jwst.description: NIRCam or NIRISS dither pattern size that indicates the dither point distribution for the INTRASCA pattern type. It is included when an FGS External Calibration dither is in parallel with either NIRCam Engineering Imaging (and PATTTYPE=INTRASCA) or NIRISS External Calibration. Possible values are NONE, SMALL, MEDIUM, LARGE. NIRCam dither pattern size indicates the dither point distribution for INTRASCA pattern type. It is N/A when NIRCam Imaging is prime with MIRI Imaging in parallel and when NIRCam WFSS is prime with NIRISS Imaging in parallel. When NIRCam Imaging is in parallel with MIRI Imaging or NIRISS WFSS, possible values are SMALL, MEDIUM, LARGE. NIRSpec IFU primary dither pattern size. Possible values are: SMALL, MEDIUM, or LARGE. Only specified when PATTTYPE is CYCLING or SPARSE_CYCLING. MIRI imaging primary dither pattern size. Possible values are: SMALL, MEDIUM, LARGE, DEFAULT. NIRISS dither pattern size indicates the dither point distribution for WFSS and IMAGE pattern types. Possible values are SMALL, MEDIUM, and LARGE. NIRSpec IFU primary dither pattern starting point values are in the range from 1 to 60. Only specified when PATTTYPE is CYCLING
jwst.name: pattsize

jwst.description: The drizzled image pixel size relative to the native detector pixel size
jwst.name: pxsclrt

jwst.description: The drizzle drop size, which is the ratio of the linear size of the drop to the original input pixel
jwst.name: pixfrac

jwst.description: The name of the association pool file used as input to the association generator to create the association table that resulted in this product
jwst.name: asnpool

jwst.description: Position number within dither pattern
jwst.name: patt_num

jwst.description: Holds the original aperture value supplied by PPS in the PPS_DB.exposures.AperName database field
jwst.name: pps_aper

jwst.description: Version number of the S&OC Project Reference Database (PRD) used in data processing
jwst.name: prd_ver

jwst.description: Number of points in NIRSpec FSS primary dither pattern type: 1 (NONE), 2 (2-POINT-NOD), 3 (3-POINT-NOD), 5 (5-POINT-NOD). Number of points in FGS primary dither pattern. When FGS is the only instrument, possible values are: 1-25. When FGS External Calibration is in parallel with NIRCam Engineering Imaging, possible values are: 2-17, 21, 25, 27, 36, 45. When FGS External Calibration is in parallel with NIRISS External Calibration, possible values are: 1, 2, 3, 4. Number of points in NIRCam primary dither pattern, extracted from PRIDTYPE. Possible values are: 1-17, 21, 25, 27, 36, 45. NIRCam number of points in primary dither pattern, extracted from PRIDTYPE, included when a MIRI Imaging dither is in parallel with NIRCam (Imaging or WFSS). In NIRCam Imaging/MIRI Imaging dithers, possible values are 2-17, 21, 25, 27, 36, 45. NIRCam WFSS/MIRI Imaging dithers can only have integer values 2-16
jwst.name: pridtpts

jwst.description: NIRISS primary dither pattern type. When NIRISS is the only instrument operating, possible values are AMI, IMAGING, MIMF, and WFSS. When NIRISS WFSS is prime with MIRI imaging in parallel, additional possible values follow the syntax NIS-MIRNNN-#, where NNN is the 3-digit value corresponding to the central wavelength of the MIRI filter in use (e.g. 077, 128, 150, 255) and # is the number of dither points (2, 3, 4, 9). When NIRISS WFSS is prime with NIRCam imaging in parallel, the format of possible values is NIS-NRC-#S, where # is the number of dither points (2, 3, 4, 9) and S is the size of the pattern (S, M, L). When NIRISS external calibration is prime with FGS external calibration in parallel, possible values are the same as when NIRISS is the only instrument operating
jwst.name: patttype

jwst.description: Identifies the exposure as PRIME, PARALLEL_COORDINATED (same program as the PRIME), or PARALLEL_PURE (different program than the PRIME)
jwst.name: expripar

jwst.description: The total exposure time of all the individual pointings included in a resampled/combined product in units of seconds
jwst.name: texptime

jwst.description: Proper motion of the target in Declination, as specified by the user in APT (arcseconds per year)
jwst.name: mu_dec

jwst.description: Epoch of the proper motion values
jwst.name: mu_epoch

jwst.description: Proper motion of the target in Right Ascension, as specified by the user in APT (arcseconds per year)
jwst.name: mu_ra

jwst.description: Target Declination as given in the phase 2 proposal, with conversion to units of degrees
jwst.name: prop_dec

jwst.description: Target Right Ascension as given in the phase 2 proposal, with conversion to units of degrees
jwst.name: prop_ra

jwst.description: This keyword indicates whether the exposure is intended to be used as a PSF reference observation for associated coronagraphic or AMI observations of science targets
jwst.name: is_psf

jwst.description: This keyword records the lamp Operating Mode selected by a user in the APT NIRSpec Internal Lamp observing template and is used to indicate how the exposures are to be processed. Possible values are MSASPEC, IFU, IMAGE, FIXEDSLIT, BRIGHTOBJ, GRATING-ONLY, and NONE
jwst.name: opmode

jwst.description: Exposure end time from the previous WFS exposure (Modified Julian Date)
jwst.name: pwfseet

jwst.description: Target Right Ascension Uncertainty computed at mid time of the exposure (arcseconds)
jwst.name: targura

jwst.description: The readout pattern (READPATT) name designates a pre-defined combination of NFRAMES, GROUPGAP, and NRESETS that was used for the exposure. Each unique combination of these parameters determines not only the timing of detector readouts and resets during an exposure, but also the cadence of the resulting data frames that are downlinked from the telescope
jwst.name: readpatt

jwst.description: The radius of the region of interest (ROI) in the spatial dimensions used to set IFU cube spaxel size. In units of arc seconds
jwst.name: rois

jwst.description: The radius of the region of interest (ROI) in the spectral dimension used to set IFU cube spaxel size. In units of arc seconds
jwst.name: roiw

jwst.description: Delta time between samples in units of microsec
jwst.name: tsample

jwst.description: Sensor Chip Assembly (SCA) number. Possible values are 1-18
jwst.name: sca_num

jwst.description: Science category assigned during TAC process
jwst.name: scicat

jwst.description: The sequential segment number in a single exposure of a Time Series Observation
jwst.name: exsegnum

jwst.description: The total number of segments in a single exposure of a Time Series Observation
jwst.name: exsegtot

jwst.description: The name of the image segmentation map file used during processing of Wide Field Slitless Spectroscopy (WFSS) exposures
jwst.name: segmfile

jwst.description: This keyword indicates whether this coronagraphic observation is to be regarded as part of a self-referencing survey, which means that it can be treated as both a science target observation and a reference PSF observation
jwst.name: selfref

jwst.description: The parallel sequence identifier is single character which is used to identify parallel sequences within a group, i.e. it indicates insturment configuration for the exposure. 'S' for no instrment, 1 for the prime insturment, or 2-5 for insurments that were operating in parallel, but not prime. The SEQ_ID is included in the observation ID
jwst.name: seq_id

jwst.description: Indicates the axis and direction of slow readout (values = 1, 2, -1, -2). The digit value is set by whether axis 1 or 2 is the fast/slow readout axis. The sign indicates the direction of the readout with respect to the science frame
jwst.name: slowaxis

jwst.description: The name of the source catalog file generated by the calibration pipeline source_catalog step for this image
jwst.name: scatfile

jwst.description: Exposure start time (Modified Julian Date).  NOTE: This keyword is present for backward compatibility with ground system software. Where possible, use the FITS Standard keyword MJD-BEG for this quantity
jwst.name: expstart

jwst.description: Observatory time when the visit started (UTC), will not appear for parallels since OSF:COMPLETED_VISIT is not populated for parallels
jwst.name: vststart

jwst.description: UTC exposure start time as calcualted from values reported in the engineering data stream (format YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ss.sss)
jwst.name: expsteng

jwst.description: Status of the visit, will not appear for parallels since OSF:COMPLETED_VISIT is not populated for parallels
jwst.name: visitsta

jwst.description: For the Guaranteed Time Observer (GTO) and Calibration (CAL) program types, the subcategory keyword values of FGS, MIRI, NIRCAM, NIRISS, NIRSPEC, and SC, are allowed. A spacecraft (SC) subcategory represents a program that is not specific to a single science instrument
jwst.name: subcat

jwst.description: Name of the subarray used when reading out the detector. If no subarray is specified, the assumption is that the full detector was read, so SUBARRAY is set to 'FULL' and the related values for X, Y start, size will reflect the full frame image. For example, the values for a NIRCAM full-frame image are SUBSTRT1=1, SUBSTRT2=1, SUBSIZE1=2048, SUBSIZE2=2048
jwst.name: subarray

jwst.description: Number of subpixel positions for NIRISS AMI pattern type. Possible values are: 1, 5, 9, 25. When NIRISS is in parallel with NIRCam, possible values are 1, 2, 3, 4, 9. Number of points in FGS subpixel dither pattern. When FGS is the only instrument, possible values are: 1, 2, 4. When FGS External Calibration is in parallel with NIRCam Engineering Imaging, possible values are: 1-9, 12, 16, 20, 24, 30, 36, 48, 64. When FGS External Calibration is in parallel with NIRISS External Calibration, possible values are: 1, 5, 9, 25. Number of points in NIRSpec FSS subpixel dither pattern. Possible values are: 1, 2, 3, 4. NIRCam number of points in subpixel dither pattern, included when a MIRI Imaging dither is in parallel with NIRCam (Imaging or WFSS), with possible values: 1, 2, 3, 4, 9. Number of points in the NIRCam subpixel dither pattern. When NIRCam is the only instrument operating possible values are 1-9, 12, 16, 20, 24, 30, 36, 48, 64. When NIRCam is prime with FGS, MIRI, or NIRISS in parallel, a more limited set of those options are allowed
jwst.name: subpxpts

jwst.description: Indicates whether or not the background signal level given in the BKGLEVEL keyword has been subtracted from the data (T/F)
jwst.name: bkgsub

jwst.description: The name of the association table from which this product was created
jwst.name: asntable

jwst.description: Target category as specified in the APT proposal, e.g., Star, Galaxy, Stellar Cluster
jwst.name: targcat

jwst.description: A character string identifying the telescope used to acquire the data associated with the header: JWST
jwst.name: telescop

jwst.description: Principal time system for time-related keywords. Universal Time Coordinated (UTC) will be used
jwst.name: timesys

jwst.description: Proposal title. The proposal title can have a length of up to 150 characters. This is longer than the 68 characters available to a single FITS keyword value. The TITLE keyword will use the FITS long string value convention to end incomplete values with an ampersand and continue the value in next record with a CONTINUE element
jwst.name: title

jwst.description: Visit scheduled as target of opportunity (T/F)
jwst.name: targoopp

jwst.description: Total number of planned exposures in the visit
jwst.name: nexposur

jwst.description: Total number of points in entire dither pattern
jwst.name: numdthpt

jwst.description: TSOVISIT indicates whether this exposure is part of a visit that used the Time Series Observation special requirement in APT and therefore needs to be processed by DMS as a TSO exposure
jwst.name: tsovisit

jwst.description: The name of the catalog file generated and used by the calibration pipeline tweakreg step when performing image alignment
jwst.name: tcatfile

jwst.description: Velocity aberration corrected Dec, in degrees
jwst.name: va_dec

jwst.description: Velocity aberration corrected RA, in degrees
jwst.name: va_ra

jwst.description: Observatory UTC time when the visit completed
jwst.name: visitend

jwst.description: The visit group is a 2 character indentifier that specifies a group within a visit file (used for parallel synchronization). It is included in the observation ID, in order to trace the exposure to the commanding request and uniquely identify the exposure
jwst.name: visitgrp

jwst.description: The eleven character visit_id, PPPPPOOOVVV, uniquely indentifies the visit and consists of the program, observation and visit destinations. This visit_id is explicitly embedded in the file name and also included in the Science Image header and footer in the Recorded Science Data file
jwst.name: visid_id

jwst.description: Specific type of visit. Possible values: GENERIC, PARALLEL_DARK_CALIBRATION, PARALLEL_EXTERNAL_CALIBRATION, PARALLEL_PURE, PARALLEL_SLEW_CALIBRATION, PRIME_STATION_KEEPING, PRIME_TARGETED_FIXED, PRIME_TARGETED_MOVING, PRIME_UNTARGETED, PRIME_WFSC_ROUTINE, PRIME_WFSC_SENSING_CONTROL, PRIME_WFSC_SENSING_ONLY, PRIOR_MOMENTUM_UNLOAD
jwst.name: visitype

jwst.description: The weighting power used to control the weighting of the distances between the point cloud member and IFU spaxel center
jwst.name: wpower

jwst.description: The type of weighting used when combining point cloud fluxes to represent the IFU spaxel flux
jwst.name: wtype

jwst.description: X offset from pattern starting position in SI ideal coordinate frame (arcsec): -84.476 to 87.276
jwst.name: xoffset

jwst.description: Number of pixels in the full science frame axis 1 direction
jwst.name: subsize1

jwst.description: Starting pixel number in the full science frame axis 1 direction
jwst.name: substrt1

jwst.description: Y offset from pattern starting position in SI ideal coordinate frame (arcsec): -61.480 to 62.260
jwst.name: yoffset

jwst.description: Number of pixels in the full science frame axis 2 direction
jwst.name: subsize2

jwst.description: Starting pixel number in the full science frame axis 2 direction
jwst.name: substrt2

jwst.description: T if zero frame was read separately. The first frame of an integration may be read out separately, even if that frame is also averaged into the first group of the integration. If there is a zero frame readout, there will be one for each integration. The zero frame will be stored in a data array in a separate fits extension
jwst.name: zerofram

jwst.description: The calibration software repository version (e.g. RELEASE)
jwst.name: cal_vcs

jwst.description: The version number of the calibration software (e.g. 1.11.4)
jwst.name: cal_ver

jwst.description: Identifies the version of the CRDS context (PMAP file) that was used to control the logic involved in selecting certain versions or instances of calibration reference files
jwst.name: crds_ctx

jwst.description: Identifies the version of the CRDS client software that was used to select calibration reference files during calibration processing
jwst.name: crds_ver

jwst.description: The entire wavelength range of the MIRI MRS is not observable in a single exposure and therefore a particular wavelength range, or sub-band, must be selected for each exposure. Three sub-band settings are available: SHORT, MEDIUM, and LONG. The selected bands are realized by changing the positions of the dichroic/grating wheel assemblies that are in the IFU optical paths. Each of the 2 wheel assemblies supplies light to 2 of the 4 IFU channels: wheel 1 supplies channels 1 and 4, while wheel 2 supplies channels 2 and 3. The light from channels 1 and 2 fall on the first MRS detector, and the light from channels 3 and 4 fall on the second MRS detector. Under normal science operations the two grating wheel assemblies will always be positioned to the same wavelength sub-band, in which case the value of this keyword will contain a single value of either SHORT, MEDIUM, or LONG. It is possible, however, for engineering modes to intentionally set the two wheels to different positions. In these cases the keyword value will contain the two unique values, such as SHORT-LONG or LONG-MEDIUM
jwst.name: miri_band

jwst.description: Identifies the MIRI contamination control cover state: open, closed, locked
jwst.name: miri_cccstate

jwst.description: For MIRI, identifies which channels (1,2,3,4) of IFU data are contained in an exposure. For exposures on the MIRIFUSHORT detector, CHANNEL will indicate that data from both channels 1 and 2 are present with a value of '12'. Similarly, for the MIRIFULONG detector, CHANNEL will be '34' to indicate that data from channels 3 and 4 are present
jwst.name: miri_channel

jwst.description: Test patterns generated by the SCE. There are four different options.  COLUMNS: Each column has a constant value. Value per channel increments from 1 to 258 across detector frame.  ROWS: Each row has a constant value. Value increments from 1 to 1024 up the detector frame.  FRAMES: All pixels in a frame have a value corresponding to the countdown from the number of frames (e.g. all pixels in the first frame of a 10 frames commanded exposure will have the value 10).  ALL: Detector channel 1: column count. Channel 2: row count. Channel 3: frame count. Channel 4: Intregration count. Reference output values are zero
jwst.name: miri_cmd_tsel

jwst.description: MIRI coronagraph mask being used
jwst.name: miri_coronmsk

jwst.description: Detector mode indicator. The 4 possible values are: FLUSH_MODE, TEST_PATTERN, CLOCKING and EXPOSURE.  FLUSH_MODE: continuos destructive read of the detector.  TEST_PATTERN: Test pattern generated by the SCE.  CLOCKING: Detector is clocked but not readout. EXPOSURE: Detector readout mode. Nominal value
jwst.name: miri_detmode

jwst.description: User-specified MIRI direction of dither pattern offsets to use, included when a NIRISS dither is in parallel with MIRI Imaging and pattern type is 4-POINT-SETS. Possible values are: POSITIVE, NEGATIVE
jwst.name: miri_ditchdirc

jwst.description: MIRI flight system number of frames
jwst.name: miri_mirnfrms

jwst.description: The DATAMODL keyword records the name of the calibration pipeline software data model class to be used when loading/accessing the data in the FITS file
jwst.name: miri_mirngrps

jwst.description: The total number of 4-point dither sets; 1-10 repeating sets can be executed. Applies only to the 4-POINT-SETS dither pattern type. Possible values are 1-10
jwst.name: miri_numdsets

jwst.description: Identifies the type of science for which the dither is optimized: point source or extended source. This field applies only to the 4-POINT-SETS pattern
jwst.name: miri_dithopfr

jwst.description: The Medium Resolution Spectroscopy (MRS) channel for which the dither pattern is optimized
jwst.name: miri_mrsprchn

jwst.description: The sparse cycling dither pattern allows the observer to specify individual positions from the cycling lookup table using a list. The DITHPNTS keyword records the specified list of points, such as [1, 3, 6-10, 23, 29-55].  Used for sparse cycling only
jwst.name: miri_dithpnts

jwst.description: MIRI LRS spatial offset from pattern starting position (arcsec). Value must be >= 0.0
jwst.name: miri_sptoffst

jwst.description: MIRI LRS position number within spatial steps. Value must be >= 1
jwst.name: miri_spat_num

jwst.description: MIRI LRS distance between steps in the spatial direction (arcsec) - point source: -0.908, 0.908; extended target. Value must be >= 0.0
jwst.name: miri_spatstep

jwst.description: MIRI LRS number of steps in the spatial direction. Value must be >= 0
jwst.name: miri_spatnstp

jwst.description: MIRI LRS spectral offset from pattern starting position (arcsec). Value must be >= 0.0
jwst.name: miri_spcoffst

jwst.description: MIRI LRS position number within spectral steps. Value must be >= 1. NIRSpec FSS position number within spectral steps. Possible values are: 1, 2, or 3
jwst.name: miri_spec_num

jwst.description: MIRI LRS distance between steps in the spectral direction (arcsec)
jwst.name: miri_specstep

jwst.description: MIRI LRS number of steps in the spectral direction. Value must be >= 1
jwst.name: miri_specnstp

jwst.description: MIRI imaging starting point in the dither cycling pattern, included when a NIRCam Imaging dither is in parallel with MIRI Imaging and pattern type is CYCLING. Possible values are: : 1-311
jwst.name: miri_pattstrt

jwst.description: The starting set number of the series of 4-point dither sets; 1-10 repeating sets can be executed. Applies only to the 4-POINT-SETS dither pattern type. Possible values are 1-10
jwst.name: miri_dsetstrt

jwst.description: MIRI imaging number of points in CYCLING dither pattern, included when a NIRISS dither is in parallel with MIRI Imaging and pattern type is CYCLING. Value must be >= 3
jwst.name: miri_pattnpts

jwst.description: Identifies the NIRCam channel (long or short). In each module a dichroic splits the incoming light into short (0.6-2.3um) and long (2.4-5.0um.) wavelength beams; the components associated with each of these beams are collectively referred to as a channel
jwst.name: nircam_channel

jwst.description: NIRCam coronagraph mask being used
jwst.name: nircam_coronmsk

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 1 absolute position value per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_fa1value

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 2 absolute position value per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_fa2value

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 3 absolute position value per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_fa3value

jwst.description: Measured position of the focus adjustment mechanism (FAM) primary sensor in steps of linear actuator 1
jwst.name: nircam_fam_la1

jwst.description: Measured position of the focus adjustment mechanism (FAM) primary sensor in steps of linear actuator 2
jwst.name: nircam_fam_la2

jwst.description: Measured position of the focus adjustment mechanism (FAM) primary sensor in steps of linear actuator 3
jwst.name: nircam_fam_la3

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 1 starting phase per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_faphase1

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 2 starting phase per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_faphase2

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 3 starting phase per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_faphase3

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 1 starting steps per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_fastep1

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 2 starting steps per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_fastep2

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 3 starting steps per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_fastep3

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 1 starting units per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_faunit1

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 2 starting units per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_faunit2

jwst.description: Requested focus actuator 3 starting units per the exposure specification
jwst.name: nircam_faunit3

jwst.description: Identifies the NIRCam module that was used (A, B or MULTIPLE)
jwst.name: nircam_module

jwst.description: NIRCam primary dither specification with number of points and possible point packing, included when a NIRISS dither is in parallel with NIRCam (Imaging or WFSS). In NIRCam Imaging/NIRISS Imaging and NIRCam Imaging/NIRISS WFSS dithers, all the enum values, except 1, apply. NIRCam WFSS/NIRISS Imaging dithers can only have integer values of 1-16
jwst.name: nircam_pridtype

jwst.description: Identifies the element of the pupil wheel that was in the optical path for the exposure. The NIRISS pupil wheel has 9 elements, consisting of bandpass filters, a grism, a Non-Redundant Mask (NRM), and the Pupil Alignment Reference (PAR), which is used for alignment purposes during ground testing. The PAR also serves as a clear position. Each channel (short, long) of each NIRCam module (A, B) is equipped with a pupil wheel containing a mixture of bandpass filters, coronagraphic pupils, weak lenses, grisms, pinholes, and a flatfield/dark element. Each pupil wheel has 11 elements and 1 clear position
jwst.name: nircam_pupil

jwst.description: Identifies if a pupil imaging lens is to be used (T/F)
jwst.name: nircam_pilin

jwst.description: Name of the small grid dither pattern for NIRCam Coronagraphic Imaging and Engineering Imaging only
jwst.name: nircam_smgrdpat

jwst.description: NIRCam subpixel dither pattern type, included when a MIRI Imaging dither is in parallel with NIRCam (Imaging or WFSS). Both include possible values in the format #_POINT_WITH_MIRI_filter where # is the number of subpixel dither points and filter is the name of the MIRI filter in use. In NIRCam Imaging/MIRI Imaging dithers, NIRCAM_ONLY is also possible. In NIRCam WFSS/MIRI Imaging dithers, additional values are 2-POINT, 4-POINT, 9-POINT, and NONE. NIRSpec FSS subpixel dither pattern. Possible values are: SPECTRAL, SPATIAL, BOTH, NONE
jwst.name: nircam_subpxpat

jwst.description: NIRISS direct image dither number of points, included when a NIRCam Imaging dither is in parallel with NIRISS WFSS and pattern type is WFSS. Possible values are: 2, 3, 4, 6, 8, 9, 12, 16
jwst.name: niriss_nrimdtpt

jwst.description: The FWCPOS keyword gives the encoder-based position of the NIRISS filter wheel during an exposure
jwst.name: niriss_fwcpos

jwst.description: Identifies the position of the FGS focus mechanism in millimeters (-4.0 to 4.0), NIRISS focus mechanism in millimeters, or NIRSpec refocus mechanism in steps (datatype = integer)
jwst.name: niriss_focuspos

jwst.description: Identifies the element of the pupil wheel that was in the optical path for the exposure. The NIRISS pupil wheel has 9 elements, consisting of bandpass filters, a grism, a Non-Redundant Mask (NRM), and the Pupil Alignment Reference (PAR), which is used for alignment purposes during ground testing. The PAR also serves as a clear position. Each channel (short, long) of each NIRCam module (A, B) is equipped with a pupil wheel containing a mixture of bandpass filters, coronagraphic pupils, weak lenses, grisms, pinholes, and a flatfield/dark element. Each pupil wheel has 11 elements and 1 clear position
jwst.name: niriss_pupil

jwst.description: The PWCPOS keyword gives the encoder-based position of the NIRISS pupil wheel during an exposure
jwst.name: niriss_pwcpos

jwst.description: Identifies the NIRSpec fixed slit aperture to be used. The FXD_SLIT keyword value will be one of the five fixed slits for single-object spectroscopy (S200A1, S200A2, S200B1, S400A1, S1600A1)
jwst.name: nirspec_fxd_slit

jwst.description: Identifies the position of the FGS focus mechanism in millimeters (-4.0 to 4.0), NIRISS focus mechanism in millimeters, or NIRSpec refocus mechanism in steps (datatype = integer)
jwst.name: nirspec_focuspos

jwst.description: Identifies the NIRSpec grating wheel assembly element was used
jwst.name: nirspec_grating

jwst.description: Grating wheel REC-averaged and calibrated X-position tilt sensor value
jwst.name: nirspec_gwa_pxav

jwst.description: Grating wheel REC-averaged and calibrated Y-position tilt sensor value
jwst.name: nirspec_gwa_pyav

jwst.description: Grating wheel temperature sensor calibrated physical value
jwst.name: nirspec_gwa_tilt

jwst.description: Grating wheel X-position tilt sensor calibrated value
jwst.name: nirspec_gwa_xp_v

jwst.description: Grating wheel tilt sensor value GWA_X_TILT_AVGED, corrected for sensor supply voltage offsets and averaged over multiple samples. In the instrument/wheel-centric reference frame this is the angle ALONG the X axis, while in the NIRSpec instrument model (used to define the WCS of the data) this is the angle AROUND the X axis, and hence is equivalent to the angle along the Y axis
jwst.name: nirspec_gwa_xtilt

jwst.description: Grating wheel Y-position tilt sensor calibrated value
jwst.name: nirspec_gwa_yp_v

jwst.description: Grating wheel tilt sensor value GWA_Y_TILT_AVGED, corrected for sensor supply voltage offsets and averaged over multiple samples. In the instrument/wheel-centric reference frame this is the angle ALONG the Y axis, while in the NIRSpec instrument model (used to define the WCS of the data) this is the angle AROUND the Y axis, and hence is equivalent to the angle along the X axis
jwst.name: nirspec_gwa_ytilt

jwst.description: Identifies when an exposure is flagged as a leakcal or imprint exposure. This information is needed by calibration
jwst.name: nirspec_is_imprt

jwst.description: Unique identifier of all the MSA configurations (nirspec_msa_config) within a visit
jwst.name: nirspec_msaconid

jwst.description: NIRSpec MSA metadata file name.  Values related to MSA configuration will be pulled from PPS_DB into this file for use in the pipeline
jwst.name: nirspec_msametfl

jwst.description: Unique identifier within a visit to the collection of information (nirspec_msa_metadata) about how a MSA configuration was used at a particular pointing
jwst.name: nirspec_msametid

jwst.description: Identifies the state of the NIRSpec MSA: all open, all closed, or configured. The MSA configuration can be found in the MSA metadata file, which is specified by the MSAMETFL keyword value
jwst.name: nirspec_msastate

jwst.description: NIRSpec MSA nod pattern type. Possible values are: NONE, 3-POINT-NOD, 2-SHUTTER-SLITLET, 3-SHUTTER-SLITLET, 5-SHUTTER-SLITLET, 5-SHUTTER-SLITLET-WITH-GAP
jwst.name: nirspec_nod_type

jwst.description: The number of normal pixels included in each block of normal+reference pixels in an image using the NIRSpec IRS2 readout scheme
jwst.name: nirspec_nrs_norm

jwst.description: The number of interleaved reference pixels included in each block of normal+reference pixels in an image using the NIRSpec IRS2 readout scheme
jwst.name: nirspec_nrs_ref

jwst.description: NIRSpec IFU primary dither pattern starting point values are in the range from 1 to 60. Only specified when PATTTYPE is CYCLING
jwst.name: nirspec_pattstrt

jwst.description: Name of the reference image that was used to measure position for this source
jwst.name: nirspec_preimage

jwst.description: NIRSpec Refocus Mechanism Assembly (RMA) latest recorded hall-position sensor value
jwst.name: nirspec_rma_pos

jwst.description: NIRSpec Refocus Mechanism Assembly (RMA) relative position, in motor steps (-18400 to +18400). The offsets are from the current position
jwst.name: nirspec_fcsrlpos

jwst.description: The sparse cycling dither pattern allows the observer to specify individual positions from the cycling lookup table using a list. The DITHPNTS keyword records the specified list of points, such as [1, 3, 6-10, 23, 29-55].  Used for sparse cycling only
jwst.name: nirspec_dithpnts

jwst.description: NIRSPEC FSS position number within spatial steps. Value must be >= 1
jwst.name: nirspec_spat_num

jwst.description: NIRSpec FSS position number within spectral steps. Possible values are: 1, 2, or 3
jwst.name: nirspec_spec_num

jwst.description: NIRCam subpixel dither pattern type, included when a MIRI Imaging dither is in parallel with NIRCam (Imaging or WFSS). Both include possible values in the format #_POINT_WITH_MIRI_filter where # is the number of subpixel dither points and filter is the name of the MIRI filter in use. In NIRCam Imaging/MIRI Imaging dithers, NIRCAM_ONLY is also possible. In NIRCam WFSS/MIRI Imaging dithers, additional values are 2-POINT, 4-POINT, 9-POINT, and NONE. NIRSpec FSS subpixel dither pattern. Possible values are: SPECTRAL, SPATIAL, BOTH, NONE
jwst.name: nirspec_subpxpat

jwst.description: Identifies the position of the FGS focus mechanism in millimeters (-4.0 to 4.0), NIRISS focus mechanism in millimeters, or NIRSpec refocus mechanism in steps (datatype = integer)
jwst.name: fgs_focuspos

jwst.description: Version number of the science data processing software
jwst.name: sdp_ver

jwst.description: Angular separation from the target coordinates, in arcmin.
jwst.name: ang_sep

jwst.description: Search Key (Concat of ArchiveFileID and search_pos)
jwst.name: search_key

list_products.description: Proprietary status of the data product
list_products.name: access

list_products.description: Data product category. May be a level (like "1b", "2b", ...)or a description of the file (like "REFERENCE" or "ASSOCIATION")
list_products.name: category

list_products.description: The file suffix for observations is usually the last characters before the file extension. For other products, the file suffix may be the extension.
list_products.name: file_suffix

list_products.description: Filter(s) used for this data product
list_products.name: filters

list_products.description: Instrument used to produce the data product
list_products.name: instrument_name

list_products.description: Unique product key used to identify the product within MAST
list_products.name: product_key

roman.description: The sequence of activities produced by each iteration of a Segment Plan (Observation Sequence) in a Pass.
roman.name: segment

roman.description: The collection of activities generated from each iteration of a Pass Plan. Multiple Passes may be generated from the same Pass Plan to allow repetition or execute at different orientations
roman.name: pass

roman.description: Product levels, 1 is Uncalibrated detector ramps, 2 =  Calibrated detector rate images, and 3 = Re-pixellated data including, e.g., co-additions and mosaics
roman.name: productLevel

roman.description: Right Ascension (J2000), from 0 to 360, in degrees
roman.name: ra_ref

roman.description: exposure type - type of data in the exposure
roman.name: exposure_type

roman.description: Principal Investigator (PI) last name; uppercase (e.g. FORD, LEMMON)
roman.name: investigator_name

roman.description: The combined filter, grating, pupil, channel, band, & coronmsk used (e.g. F062, F087)
roman.name: optical_element

roman.description: ID number (integer) assigned to the proposal    (e.g. 1012, 12045)
roman.name: program

roman.description: Data access status (PUBLIC or RESTRICTED=exclusive data)
roman.name: access

roman.description: Search Key (Concat of sci_data_set_name and search_pos)
roman.name: search_key
